alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 4:44AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: .Warmer temperatures have accelerated snowmelt, leading to water and debris flowing over portions of SR-226 near MM 15. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nevada, including the following county, Elko. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 AM PDT, Nevada Department of Transportation reported flooding in SR-226 near MM 15. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in SR-226 near MM 15. - SR-226 near MM 15 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Elko County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
